title: Modeling a Non-Periodic Context-Exponential Function, Part A

content.question: Part A (i)Use the given data to write two equations that can be used to find the values for constants <math alttext="a"> <mi>a</mi> </math> and <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math> in the expression for <math alttext="F open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>F</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math>. (ii)Find the values for <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math> and <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math> as decimal approximations.

topic.text: 2.5: Exponential Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
